required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Iron Deficiency Anemia Among Chinese Pregnant Women: a Multi-center Prospective Cohort Study
clinical_study.official_title: Iron Deficiency Anemia Among Chinese Pregnant Women (IRON WOMEN): a Multi-center Prospective Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: Iron deficiency anemia during pregnancy, which may lead to adverse pregnancy outcomes, was a serious health problem in China. Various iron supplements used in different regions of China, however, the effects have not been well investigated. The objective of this study is to investigate the diagnosis, treatment and prognosis of iron deficiency and iron deficiency anemia in Chinese pregnant women.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a nationwide multicenter prospective cohort study conducted in seven hospitals in China to investigate the diagnosis, treatment and prognosis of iron deficiency and iron deficiency anemia in Chinese pregnant women. This study will enroll about 6000-7000 pregnant women, who established a health record in the seven hospitals. Demographic characteristics, laboratory tests, behavior habits during pregnancy, mental status, and pregnancy outcomes will been collected. All information will collect by a pregnant women self-reported questionnaire and the electronic medical record system in hospitals at three timing points: 6-15 gestational weeks, 30-34 gestational weeks and one week after delivery.

primary_outcome.description: Including iron deficiency anemia rate, pregnancy hypertension syndrome rate, gestational diabetes mellitus rate, cesarean section rate, and other adverse maternal outcomes rate. The definition of adverse maternal outcome was according to International Glossary on Infertility and Fertility Care (2017), and the rate of adverse maternal outcome was calculated by the number of adverse maternal outcome divided by the total number of pregnant women.

Including miscarriage rate, premature birth rate, birth defect rate, low birth weight rate, and other adverse neonatal outcomes. The definitions of adverse neonatal outcomes were according to International Glossary on Infertility and Fertility Care (2017), and the rate of adverse neonatal outcomes were calculated by the number of advers neonatal outcomes divided by the total number of pregnancy or birth.

arm_group.description: Chinese women with iron deficiency anemia (IDA) during pregnancy.
Chinese women without iron deficiency anemia (IDA) during pregnancy.

intervention.intervention_name: Iron deficiency anemia in Chinese pregnant women
intervention.description: Iron deficiency anemia exists in Chinese pregnant women during pregnancy

study_pop.textblock: Chinese pregnant women who established a health record at one of the survey hospital in seven cities of China.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women who registered an antenatal care file at the survey hospital ;
- Signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participated in any drug or nutritional clinical trial from 3 months before pregnancy to recruitment.

facility.name: Chongqing Health center for women and Children
Xiamen Maternal and Child Care Hospital
Hubei Maternal and Child Care Hospital
The West China Second University Hospital
Women'S Hospital School of Medicine Zhejiang University

reference.citation: Haider BA, Olofin I, Wang M, Spiegelman D, Ezzati M, Fawzi WW; Nutrition Impact Model Study Group (anaemia). Anaemia, prenatal iron use, and risk of adverse pregnancy outcomes: systematic review and meta-analysis. BMJ. 2013 Jun 21;346:f3443. doi: 10.1136/bmj.f3443. Review.

patient_data.ipd_description: Data can be shared with other researchers with the agreement of the Coordinating Committee and the Ethics Committee.
